standard_metadata.standard_description: Interpret division of a whole number by a unit fraction, and compute such quotients.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Dividing whole numbers by unit fractions visually

question.content: **If $3$ wholes are divided into pieces that are each $\dfrac16$ of a whole, how many pieces are there?**   $3\div\dfrac16 =$

images.alt: Three circles. The first circle is divided into six equal-sized parts with all parts shaded.
The second circle is divided into six equal-sized parts with all parts shaded.
The third circle is divided into six equal-sized parts with all parts shaded.

hints.content: To solve $3\div\dfrac16$, we can divide $3$ into $\dfrac16$ pieces and count the number of pieces.
[[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]    [[☃ image 3]]  There are $18$ pieces.

images.alt: Three circles. Each circle is divided into six equal-sized parts. All parts are shaded. The parts in the topmost circle are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6.
The parts in the middle circle are labeled 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12.
The parts in the bottom circle are labeled 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, and 18.
